titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Lawson G. Webster, Judgment
CWG5641

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky, Fayette Circuit Court,
June Term 1864, June 13th 1864,

Comth of Kentucky Plaintiff
against } On Indict No 1, (Deal Faro,)
Lawson G. Webster Defendant

The Commonwealth came by her attorney, and the defendant appeared and by agreement of the parties and with leave of the Court, It is adjudged that the plaintiff recover of the defendant Five hundred dollars and also her costs herein expended.

a true copy -- att Jno B Norton c f c
By Chas F Lowry DC

Comth Kentucky
vs. } Copy Judgt No 1.
Webster Lawson G
Laws. Webster is one of the cleverest gentlemen in the world, and if you can help him, I shall be gratified

W. S Downey
For Defendant Webster
